column1: A DISTORTED IMAGE of downtown city streets at night
This is not a FISHEYE LENS, but the REFLECTION in the mirrored surface of a helmet visor
A near-future MOTORCYCLE stops near a dramatic HIGH-RISE
The rider, clad in black leather, climbs off his machine
He conceals himself in an alcove, eyes never leaving the building's entrance
A uniformed DOORMAN opens the high-rise's lobby door for a HANDSOME YOUNG MAN in a TUXEDO and TRENCHCOAT
THE ASSASSIN has been waiting for this
He removes what looks like a rifle scope from his jacket, aims it at
SCOPE POV - focusing on TUXEDO'S FACE, magnified
NUMBER reads out and the name, "LIONEL ALEXANDER CANTER," along with other personal information below
THE ASSASSIN puts away the scanner scope, satisfied
He reaches a hand into a pocket, withdraws a mysterious
The size of a first generation cellphone, it has a military look, with a clear sliding panel over safety switches and buttons
The ASSASSIN hurries toward TUXEDO, but before he can
A sleek, futuristic LIMOUSINE pulls up and TUXEDO gets in the back
The ASSASSIN, frustrated, dashes for his MOTORCYCLE
He starts it and pursues the limousine
THE MOTORCYCLE pursues the LIMOUSINE along the Potomac,
FORMAL CROWDS, a RED CARPET, signs for an OPERA
TUXEDO leans forward to the DRIVER, a muscular, handsome man in a suit named ARMANDO
I'm not really in the mood for opera, Armando
ARMANDO nods knowingly pulls back into traffic
Let's not mention this to my Dad
As he speaks, he passes a few BILLS over the seat
THE LIMO moves through this seemingly deserted area, pulls up near a STEEL DOOR with a spray-painted X
TUXEDO emerges sans jacket and tie, his dress-shirt open
I can find my way back
TUXEDO moves toward the entrance, says a word into an INTERCOM with a
The door opens within moments, he disappears inside
THE ASSASSIN parks his bike, a few steps behind
Tuxedo has vanished through the STEEL DOOR before he can catch up with him
The ASSASSIN takes off his helmet, tries the door
The DOOR slides open a crack--
THE BOUNCER is a huge, bald man with JET BLACK skin, RED
EYES and TEETH that glow fluorescently
I just need to talk to--
THE STEEL DOOR has already shut in his face
BODIES SLAM together in a brutal mosh pit, MEN and WOMEN
All are young, some beautiful, others extremely decorated and pierced
They tear at each other brutally, trying to do real damage
On the edges of the pit, individual FISTFIGHTS go on
An incongruous CHANDELIER overhead, gilt-edged MIRRORS on the walls-- the FIGHTERS SLAM INTO and SHATTER them
A HARD-CORE BAND plays on an elevated stage
MUSICIANS are heavily punked out, in outlandish clothes, with pierced faces, tattoos and body make-up
IN A VIP AREA, a balcony elevated above the stage, numerous BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE at tables
Many are making out, gay, straight, threesomes-- orgies happen up here
He raises a GLASS TUBE attached to a CORD, one of a few leading into an ELECTRONIC DEVICE on the table
As he brings the tube close to his own neck, an ARC of electricity jumps to his skin
His features go slack, a shudder goes through him
Then he lowers the tube with a smile
He's using a JACKER-- a sort of electro-shock hookah
A stunningly beautiful BLONDE in edgy, dramatic clothes stands nearby
Tuxedo, recovering from the hit, gestures graciously for her to sit
She picks up one of the cords, gives him a sly smile
SPARKS fly to her tongue and--
RAIN pours down as TUXEDO and the BLONDE burst out the door, laughing
He pushes her against a brick wall, they grope each other hungrily, hands inside clothes, getting drenched in the warm downpour
WITH THE ASSASSIN, wearing his HELMET with the VISOR UP, as he approaches the entwined couple
ANGLE ON the alley's mouth as we hear the BLONDE'S
Seconds later she staggers out, clutching her head, and collapses to the pavement
THE ASSASSIN emerges on his bike, rides directly over her body unconcerned-- and ROARS into the night
Also, a great number of SUPER-CELL TOWERS and DISHES, considerably larger than the ones we see today
CAMERA PICKS UP SPEED, moves quickly to a run-down part of the city, tenements and vacant lots
MOVE DOWN and through a third-story window of--
A MAN and a WOMAN move stealthily up the stairs, LASER-SIGHT GUNS in hand
The man is THOMAS GREER, the woman JENNIFER PETERS
Greer's spent his life in law enforcement
He's smart and able, wants things to make sense-- but as the world changes around him, he feels he's losing the thread
PETERS is junior to Greer, her attitude's professional but rigid, by the book
GREER, in the lead, waves PETERS up
They approach a door at the end of the hall
We see now that their windbreakers read "FBI
Lit by CANDLES and KEROSENE LANTERNS, SMOKE HANGS in the room
We glimpse BODIES hanging from the ceiling in
GREER and PETERS train their LASERS around the place, disturbed by the scene
A flash of MOVEMENT in a bedroom and a CRASH--
THE PSYCHO who lives here has kicked over a LANTERN, FIRE spills across the floor
We glimpse a surprisingly good- looking guy, grinning maniacally
GREER squeezes off a couple of SHOTS
The PSYCHO's too fast, he LEAPS through a cracked WINDOW
The PSYCHO FALLS thirty feet into a pile of soft DIRT and TRASH
He rolls to the bottom, gets to his feet and runs
GREER looks down from the broken window
PETERS is beating at the FLAMES with a towel, sees Greer is preparing to jump
Where' s the sport in that?
He reaches the ground and sets off after the PSYCHO at top speed
PLAY A FRANTIC FOOT CHASE, both men scramble over chain- link fences, leap over trashed cars
GREER pursues the PSYCHO around a corner, into a passageway between buildings--
Greer ducks fast, the blow catches him inthearm, he drops his gun
The PSYCHO moves to pick uptheweapon, but Greer tackles him against a dumpster
Greer SLAMS the dumpster lid on the man repeatedly
You have the right to remain silent--
But the PSYCHO has grabbed something from the trash, manages to SQUIRT BUG SPRAY in Greer's eyes
Greer's blinded temporarily, the PSYCHO squirms away, running from between buildings across a street--
WHAM! He's hit full-on by a SEMI, his body FLIES through the air
He LANDS HARD on cement, but amazingly is still alive
He tries to get up, but--
GREER plants a foot on his chest and holds him fast against the ground
Greer, still wiping at this eyes, points his weapon at the PSYCHO's head
The PSYCHO grins-- then his head lolls back, eyes empty
PETERS is by a WOMAN'S BODY on the floor, holding a pocket SCANNER close to her head
This small device resembles an iPhone
There's tape over the woman's eyes and mouth, which Peters peels away as she speaks into a tiny cellphone earpiece
? My name is Jennifer Peters, with the FBI's surrogate crime division
ON SCANNER-- the name "KATHY WELLES," "REPORTED STOLEN," contact information below
ON GREER'S SCANNER - "NEW-U RENTAL AGENCY," with an ID
GREER kneels beside the PSYCHO's body, pockets his scanner
He's angry but resigned, he was half expecting this
THE SEMI DRIVER is still behind the wheel of his rig
GREER rises as his PHONE CHIMES, he touches his earpiece
IN BG, the DRIVER pulls away
He disconnects, reaches to turn the PSYCHO's head to one side
The back of his skull is smashed
Instead of gore and brains, we see torn GRAY PLASTIC and dense CIRCUITRY, oozing pinkish hydraulic fluid at his neck
We're in a world of SURROGATES, remotely operated synthetic humans (also known as SYNTHs)
These are not artificially-intelligent robots-- each is linked directly to a human being, miles or hundreds of miles away
Surrogates are distinguishable from flesh-and-blood humans primarily by their physical perfection-- ugly surrogates are rare
On closer look, their eyes may have an inhuman quality
Without a human mind sending and receiving impulses, they are completely inert
Suddenly the PSYCHO comes to life, spins his head around at an impossible angle and BITES GREER'S HAND
Greer stomps on the-PSYCHO's head, reaches with his other hand into the back of the skull to wrench out a CIRCUIT BOARD
The PSYCHO finally stops writhing, disconnected
PETERS talks on the phone while scanning a SEVERED HEAD
The WOMAN on the floor TWITCHES, her eyes open
She sits up on her elbows, looks down to see--
The bottom half of her is missing, her tattered T-shirt covers the damage, soaked with dark green and pink liquids-- coolant and hydraulic fluids
Your insurance ought to cover it
GREER trudges toward the building, on his cell, leaving the body behind
He turns the CIRCUIT BOARD over in his fingers
Coulda just called it in, we'd a shut him down from here--
Any ID from the rental agency?
Yeah, got a name from their office in
Don't be in a rush to get home,
Pit, hard-core club on F street
GREER picks up the pace, heads OUT OF FRAME
START ON THE BLONDE, eyes empty, face against the cement
Or something happened to the operator
GREER and PETERS stand over the corpse, a UNIFORM stands nearby
Greer holds his SCANNER near her head
Registered to a Cameron Michaels, out in Clarksburg
GREER is leaning closer to the dead Blonde's face
X-CLOSE-- CRACKS in the GLASS of her eye
FRAGMENTED REFLECTION as he peers at this
The UNIFORM leads GREER and PETERS past the blonde, into the alley
TUXEDO lies on his side, eyes closed
Couldn't get an ID from this one
GREER kneels by Tuxedo, looks at his fancy CUFFLINKS
A tux? Kind of over-dressed for a jacker joint
BY TUXEDO's FACE, the SCANNER reads "NO SIGNAL
GREER lifts one of Tuxedo's eyelids-- CLOSE, shattered
Greer reaches behind Tuxedo's head, pulls out a small specially-shaped TOOL and pries up the PANEL at the back of Tuxedo's skull
THE CIRCUIT BOARD, melted and scorched
So much for the identity chip
Maybe diagnostics can make sense of it
Greer stands up, looks toward the Blonde's body
Clarksburg's just up the 270, let's talk to our witness
You always work these kind of hours?
Greer is already on the move, Peters reluctantly follows
A slightly futuristic sedan speeds through light late- night traffic
We hear the VOICE of the PROPHET
You can be what you want, do what you want, nothing can hurt you
But you have ceased to live
PETERS has her eyes closed in the passenger seat
THE VOICE on the RADIO continues IN BG through scene
You think you control your surrogates, but it is they who have taken over your lives
You lie in your cells, pale and fat prisoners, while the puppets walk and dance and make love
Are we actually listening to the
Prophet? We oughta lock this guy up and throw away the key
Dreads've gotta be behind half the crimes against surries nationwide--
They dread the present, they dread
You know this joker's calling for an uprising
In Denver, we got the go- ahead to jam his broadcasts
Sounds like they're doing a bang-up job out there
's the heart of the action, right? Plus my ex and I were in the same office, it got a little uncomfortable
You get along with your last partner?
Had no idea he was that old
But this I promise soon the abominations shall fall where they stand and on that day of resurrection, the dead shall rise
MOVE ACROSS the facade of a suburban apartment complex
A RED GLOW suffuses most of the windows, all of which are
In this warm light, we glimpse OPERATORS in reclining chairs, motionless
They could be watching TV, but no sets are in sight
MOVE TO FIND GREER and PETERS as they exit the sedan and pass a sign
GREER and PETERS walk along an almost prison-like corridor, SURVEILLANCE CAMERAS, heavy doors
They follow an empty-faced walking MANNEQUIN in an ugly pantsuit
Her mouth moves like a ventriloquist's dummy as she speaks self-consciously
I been having problems with my surrie, this is just a loaner
Is there some kind of trouble?
Pays the rent on time, never leaves the apartment
Cam? Wake up, the police are here to talk to you
The LANDLADY undoes the MULTIPLE LOCKS on the door of a small one-room apartment
She opens it and lets GREER and PETERS inside
A RED GLOW from the far end of the room-- GREER flicks on overheads
The Landlady hovers by the door as they move into the place
It's minimalist, nothing on the walls
Skirts, stockings, high-heels strewn around haphazardly
We also glimpse a large CHARGING CRADLE, contact points embedded in the foam inside, shaped to accomodate a curvaceous female body
A fat, hairy arm hangs over the side of a high-tech
The two feds move quickly to see--
--CAMERON MICHAELS, a 40-ish, overweight, bald male in his underwear
BLOOD runs from his nose, his face twitches slightly he lies in a STIM CHAIR
STIM CHAIRS resemble-oversized massage chairs, contoured to the body, with padded head supports
They vibrate and electronically stimulate the user to prevent atrophy
A SENSORY PROJECTOR sits beside the chair
This device looks like a COMPUTER TOWER
HEADSET, with contact points around the skull

GREER quickly detaches the headset, rips a small
ELECTRONIC SLEEVE off of Cameron's fingertip

While Peters calls in BG, GREER moves to the PROJECTOR'S
MONITOR SCREEN and taps a touchpad
GREER REWINDS to POVs at the hard- core CLUB
FAST FORWARD to the ALLEY, making out with
This is a recording of recent experience, as seen through the eyes of the BLONDE
Tuxedo breaks the kiss and turns to look OS

ELECTRONIC SCREECH, Tuxedo's face contorts in pain and his EYES BURST, fragments of GLASS and ELECTRONICS fly
The POV reels, we hear the Blonde's SCREAM-- and STATIC again fills the screen
GREER is disturbed by this, looks again at the unconscious, quivering face of the man in the chair
A mostly empty car, scattered SURRIE PASSENGERS ride stiffly, zoned out, empty expressions except for a long-haired DREAD, one of the anti-surrogate fanatics
He's disheveled, hippyish, SHOUTS into the empty faces of the surrogates
He moves to a YOUNG COUPLE, both slack-faced, on standby
Wake up and smell the piss!
He starts to UNZIP in front of them
The DREAD turns-- GREER is holding up a BADGE
The Dread scowls, zips up and moves away from Greer, plunks down at the end of the car
GREER approaches an urban APARTMENT COMPLEX on foot, carrying a bag of TAKE-OUT FOOD
CAMERAS and SCANNERS, all commonplace in this world
We see the RED GLOW from a few windows
GREER moves tiredly down a long hallway to his apartment
He punches in a CODE at the door
GREER enters, crosses a living room that's been decorated in a spare, modern style
GREER sets the bag down on a table, fills a glass with
WATER and moves down a hallway to a BEDROOM
GREER enters the bedroom, places the water glass on a bedside table beside--
He looks five years older, twenty pounds heavier than his surrogate
RECLINER, attached to a SENSORY PROJECTOR like the one we saw on Cameron Michaels
GREER, a surrogate we now realize, undresses, puts his clothes aside in a CLOSET-- which also contains a foam- filled CHARGING CRADLE
Down to his underwear, he backs into this, seems to relax
We hear a low HUM and--
He disconnects the HEADSET and FINGERSLEEVE, the RED GLOW is replaced by WHITE
He sits up, yawns and sips the water
He rises wearily, stretches, runs a hand through his thinning hair
He moves to shut the closet door on his synth unit
GREER (the real one) sits at the table in a bathrobe, finishing the food his surrogate brought home
As he empties the remains into the trash--
She's Greer's wife, a stylish young woman, looking ridiculously good for someone who's just gotten up
Maggie starts at the sight of Greer, begins to retreat
It's as if she's stumbled upon him in the bathroom
I was about to get some sleep
Maggie enters the kitchen, not looking directly at Greer
She puts some bread in a toaster, prepares coffee
Some poor cross-sexual had an aneurysm while he was online, had to get him to a hospital
Maggie winces, disturbed by her husband's job
She flips on a small flatscreen TV, volume low
I think I need a new stim chair

No thanks, it's just some irritation
Well, there's room on the credit card
It's been a while since we've actually been together
Because I think we're doing just fine
I wish that instead of working every night, you would come out with me, go dancing, we used to have such a good time--
I was thinking more like a vacation
Bridget said she got an amazing deal on a surrie rental in Tahiti-- she looked just like a native
I mean a real vacation-- just us
Maggie takes it with her coffee out of the room
She shakes her head, amused at Greer's crazy ideas
She takes her breakfast through a door in the hall just off the kitchen-- we can't see inside the room
We hear the DOOR LOCK behind her
GREER looks after his wife, a bit dejected
In the quiet he registers a voice from the TV
ON TV - the sign "AIR QUALITY - UNHEALTHFUL
PEDESTRIANS with surgical MASKS and even GASMASKS

From the blast, BLEACH TO WHITE
A BEAUTIFUL GIRL ENTERS FRAME, turns TO CAMERA and smiles
Behind her, more happy, healthy, handsome YOUNG
PEOPLE in an abstract, WHITE SPACE
ON TV - The LOGO for VSI comes on the screen
A wood-paneled hallway of an Ivy League dorm, TWO MALE
UNDERGRADS (pimply, glasses, overweight, clearly not surries) KNOCK on a dorm room door
As soon as they enter, the UNDERGRADS choke on the stench, covering their noses
IN THE BED is a YOUNG MALE CORPSE, a SENSORY PROJECTOR attached to his head, the RED GLOW
OVERHEAD LIGHTS flick on to reveal goopy BLOOD at his nose and ears, the pillow soaked
Tuxedo's operator turned up, student at Yale name of Anthony

Well, you get a little tired of property crime, vandalism--
Thought you took your job seriously
Surrogates are extensions of people's selves--
ANTHONY STONE, Greer's BOSS, has entered Greer's office during the above

He's clearly heard this argument before
Synthetic units have the same rights as biologicals
Fact is, most of the people you refer to as Dreads are just too poor to afford a synth
You think they like living on reservations?
The restricted areas were their idea, they hate being around surries
He leans between them, hits a button on Greer's computer
ON SCREEN - A NEW HAVEN PD LOGO at the top of the screen, indicating this is an EVIDENCE FILE

FOOTSTEPS, Tuxedo pulls away from the BLONDE--
THE ASSASSIN narrows his eyes-- then WHITE LIGHT fills the screen, the BLONDE'S SCREAM CUTS OUT as the audio goes
GREER, PETERS and STONE react to this
Pathologist said his brains looked like soup
What could do that to someone?
A massive power surge shoots through the network
Two people in a narrow alley, surrounded by fire escapes, cell towers
Got a better idea? In any case, let's be discreet about this
There'll be panic in the streets if the public gets the idea that using their surries can kill them
He points to the face of the ASSASSIN, partly shielded within his helmet
They only get a partial of his face, it ENLARGES and

GREER, PETERS and STONE take this in, stunned
STONE leans closer to the intercom
Under no circumstances do you discuss this matter with anyone, inside or outside the Bureau
GREER disconnects the intercom, STONE moves to leave
ARMANDO, the limousine driver from the opening sequence, is posted amidst the mirrors and plush furniture
An elegantly dressed CLERK is at the lobby desk, checking on a COMPUTER SCREEN
But no weapons are permitted in the penthouse
You'll have to leave them with me
At Greer's nod, Peters takes out her holstered GUN

The Clerk passes him a KEY

You're the one who drove Anthony
I gave the police a statement
AT A PRIVATE ELEVATOR, while ARMANDO turns a key, a
SCANNER automatically swings out on a cantilevered arm
LIGHT flashes in their faces as they're scanned
The elevator doors open, and the three of them get on
CLOSE ON SCANNER - after they've entered the elevator, small HEAD-SHOTS of GREER and PETERS, vital stats below, appear one after the other on the SCREEN

Kid liked the wild side, huh

Armando moves ahead of them to announce their presence
Canter must get a piece of every surrogate they sell

We're very sorry for your loss, sir

I can't help noticing, your surrogate-- it's very similar to the unit your son was using

Canter at different stages of life, from youth to almost elderly

I allowed Tony to borrow one of my surrogates when he wanted to spend time in D

Canter-- we don't know of any way to kill an operator remotely

I the sad fact is, Tony and I were just getting to know each other he grew up with his mother in California

If this wasn't an accident then it's because of me that he's

Jim and I talked about it, but

If he thinks of anything else

MOVES quickly from the study, and THROUGH A WALL to find--

BADGES around their necks with the VSI logo

The son of one of your company's founders

X-CLOSE on the dense, blackened and partially melted
CIRCUIT BOARD, a labyrinth of LINES and PATTERNS
